title: Group of 16 Americans and a Canadian Kidnapped in Haiti
summary: State Department says it is working with Haitian authorities over gang's abduction of missionaries from Ohio-based group. A group of American missionaries working in Haiti was kidnapped by a notorious gang amid a sharp rise in abductions and political turmoil in the Caribbean nation, a spokesman for the Haitian Justice Ministry said.

title: China's Economy Slowed Sharply in the Third Quarter
summary: Power shortages and supply-chain problems added to the impact from Beijing's efforts to rein in the real estate and technology sectors. BEIJING-China's economy grew 4.9% in the third quarter from a year earlier, slowing sharply from the previous quarter's 7.9% growth rate, as power shortages and supply-chain problems added to the impact from Beijing's efforts to rein in the real estate and technology sectors.

title: Unions Push Companies as Workers Stay Scarce
summary: Union leaders say pandemic frustrations spur 'new militancy'; critics warn that work stoppages could backfire. Union leaders are pressing to increase their ranks and secure gains for their members as workers demand more from their employers and companies struggle with labor shortages and snarled supply chains.

title: Saks E-Commerce Unit Begins IPO Preparations
summary: Public offering could value company at $6 billion, take place in first half of 2022. The fast-growing e-commerce business of luxury retailer Saks Fifth Avenue is aiming to go public soon at a valuation roughly triple what it was pegged at earlier this year, in a sign of the boom times for online department-store sales.

title: Chicago Comes Back to Win Its First WNBA Championship
summary: The Sky came from 14 points down in Game 4 to beat the Phoenix Mercury to clinch the title. The Chicago Sky rallied from a 14-point deficit in the second half to stun the Phoenix Mercury 80-74 Sunday at Chicago's Wintrust Arena and win the Sky's first WNBA title.

title: Hollywood Strike Averted as Workers, Studios Reach a Deal
summary: Film and television industry avoids shutdown of production after union reaches last-minute deal with studios and streaming services. LOS ANGELES-The film and television industry avoided a shutdown of production on Saturday evening after the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees reached a last-minute, tentative agreement with studios and streaming services over worker demands.

title: 'The White Ship' Review: A Fateful Medieval Joy Ride
summary: An ill-fated crossing of the English Channel ended in a maritime disaster, with long-running consequences for a dynasty.. Just before midnight on Nov. 25, 1120, the White Ship left the northern French harbor of Barfleur, bound for the English port of Southampton. On board the stately vessel were nearly 300 passengers, including the aristocratic elite of the prosperous Anglo-Norman realm then ruled by Henry I. Foremost among them, and the focus of Henry's dynastic hopes, was his sole legitimate son and heir, the 17-year-old William Ætheling.

title: The Amess Assassination
summary: Was the killer of a Tory Member of Parliament motivated by radical Islamic sympathies?. The murder on Friday of Member of Parliament David Amess as he met with constituents has shocked Britain, and it ought to concern other Western democracies too. It's the first assassination of a British political figure by an apparent Islamist that we can recall, and it raises troubling questions about assimilation and democratic norms.

title: Big Labor and the Supply Shortage
summary: Unions show their power amid inflation and demand for workers.. Forget what you've heard about the downfall of organized labor. A spate of strikes across the country is highlighting the power of unions amid today's national worker shortage, with potentially damaging consequences for the continuing nationwide supply problems.

title: The Return of Trump's Remain in Mexico Policy
summary: Amid chaos at the border, Biden moves to reinstate a migrant policy he denounced.. The Biden Administration has botched immigration policy as badly as it did the Afghanistan withdrawal, and it now may suffer the indignity of re-adopting a Trump-era border policy that candidate Joe Biden denounced as un-American.

title: Mexico Moves to Seize American Assets
summary: Why does López Obrador have the impression that Biden doesn't care?. Under cover of darkness, according to a person familiar with the matter, Mexican National Guard troops sealed the front gates of the Monterra Energy fuel terminal in Tuxpan, Veracruz, last month. The facility was closed by order of Mexico's energy regulator.

title: Biden's Power Over Energy
summary: Will 'bold' action against climate change include abuse of his national-security authority?. The White House's developing response to a global energy crisis raises an unsettling question: If the Biden administration openly discusses restricting energy exports to combat rising consumer fuel prices, what power might it assert to save a planet it believes to be in crisis?

title: The Woke, Elvis and America's Great Awakenings
summary: This isn't the first time in history that a wave of youthful righteousness has tried to transform America.. John Lennon laid down a famous dictum: "Before Elvis, there was nothing." Darkness was upon the face of the deep. Elvis Presley was the big bang. The new universe of rock 'n' roll emerged ex nihilo. Elvis's music brought forth a new culture. Before you knew it a vast young audience was rocking to Sam the Sham and the Pharaohs. The rest is history. The poet Philip Larkin satirized the moment: "Sexual intercourse began in 1963."

title: Now, Go Where No Man Has Gone Before
summary: America should be taking the lead in space exploration again.. Space tourism has arrived, coming into its own with the launch, orbit and safe return of civilians to Earth on SpaceX's Inspiration4 mission in September. Watching that mission was gratifying. It was American ingenuity at its finest and showed that space missions have evolved from a public enterprise to a private one. But it also reinforced the urgency of reasserting broader American leadership in space.

title: Alumni Unite for Freedom of Speech
summary: Many left-of-center professors now realize that they too can be brutally canceled by the mob.. Readers of these pages are well aware that free speech, academic freedom and viewpoint diversity are in big trouble at U.S. universities. But many of those worried over the state of campuses are almost resigned to the idea that the forces of illiberal intolerance have won. The fight is far from over. On Oct. 18, five alumni groups are announcing the creation of an organization to stand up for open inquiry: the Alumni Free Speech Alliance.

title: In 2022, It's the Culture, Stupid
summary: Democrats' economic overreach is bad enough, but it isn't the Republicans' most effective line of attack.. Progressive Democrats, not content to accept incremental steps toward a larger, more powerful government, have invested their hopes and proposals in President Biden's bloated reconciliation package. They want to use their party's slender majorities to move the country as hard left as they can, fearing midterm election losses mean they won't soon get the chance again.

title: Democrats Face Benefits and Climate Consensus Deadline
summary: Party lawmakers are immersed in whittling down a package initially pegged at roughly $3.5 trillion to an amount centrists can support. WASHINGTON-Democrats still tussling over how to scale back their ambitions to expand the country's social benefits and overhaul its climate-change policy face dwindling time to reach an agreement as both the House and Senate return to Washington this week.

title: Behind the Energy Crisis: Fossil Fuel Investment Drops, and Renewables Aren't Ready
summary: Resume Subscription. An energy price shock is serving as a reminder of the world's continued dependency on fossil fuels-even amid efforts to shift to renewable sources of energy.

title: Economy Week Ahead: China GDP, U.S. Industry and Housing
summary: China's economic growth likely eased in the third quarter.

title: Failure Was Always an Option for Elizabeth Holmes
summary: If somebody had told her, she would have avoided a world of trouble.. As the Elizabeth Holmes trial for alleged fraud at her startup Theranos winds on, the biggest question is: When the company's blood testing machines didn't work, why didn't she change tactics? Real entrepreneurs fail early and often. Ms. Holmes instead was stubborn and chose deception over failure. That's a shame. Despite today's IPO and SPAC fireworks, the truth is that in Silicon Valley most ideas fail. Heck, most companies fail. More than half of venture-capital investments are smoking holes in the ground. Fortunately, success often rises from the ashes of ruin.

title: The FBI Needs a Wray of Courage
summary: Stand against Merrick Garland's effort to intimidate parents.. Attorney General Merrick Garland's memorandum instructing the Federal Bureau of Investigation to develop strategies for monitoring "harassment, intimidation, and threats of violence" against local school personnel presents an opportunity for FBI Director Christopher Wray. While Mr. Garland's order notes in passing that "spirited debate about policy matters is protected under our Constitution," it is clearly intended to intimidate parents and as such is a threat to their First Amendment rights.

title: Nigeria's Criminal Gangs Steal Munitions and Extort the Government
summary: Criminal gangs, flush with ransom money, are growing more brazen, stealing heavy munitions and extorting the government. GUSAU, Nigeria-The masked men emerged from the forest on motorbikes, surrounding a young intelligence officer clutching a cash-filled bag. The ransom, nearly $50,000 in crisp Nigerian bank notes, wasn't for a person, but to retrieve a weapon that directly threatened the country's president.

title: Magnet Fishing, a Pandemic Craze, Is Now Creating Trash Problems
summary: Enthusiasts say they clean waterways by fishing for scrap metal. Others say the hobby leaves a slimy mess; bicycles, fencing, baby carriages. BERLIN-Bored early in the pandemic, Constantin Chiteala went with a few friends to a nearby lake, tied a $6 magnet to a rope, tossed it into the water and pulled out a bicycle.

title: Bill Clinton Is Released From Hospital
summary: Former president had been hospitalized since Tuesday for a non-Covid-19 infection. Former President Bill Clinton was released from a California hospital on Sunday after several days of treatment for a non-Covid-19 infection.

title: Phil Collins Sets Off a New Battle Over the Alamo
summary: Resume Subscription.

title: British Police Question Alleged Attacker in Killing of Conservative Lawmaker David Amess
summary: Suspect identified as a 25-year-old British citizen of Somali descent, an official said. LONDON-British police Sunday were questioning a 25-year-old man they say stabbed to death a Conservative member of parliament as authorities sought to determine whether he was motivated by Islamic extremism.

title: How to Prevent China From Invading Taiwan
summary: A change in posture will be necessary.. Regarding William Galston's column "Will America Come to Taiwan's Defense?" (Politics & Ideas, Oct. 13): The policy of strategic ambiguity is still useful; what matters is how it is implemented. The steady deterioration of American naval power in the Taiwan theater makes things far less ambiguous to China's leadership. For example, dispatching our sole operational aircraft carrier in the South China Sea to the Persian Gulf to support our withdrawal from Afghanistan is a clear indication of America's weakened ability to implement any policy.

title: In North Carolina, Let the People Rule
summary: This power grab would call into question the legitimacy of the state Supreme Court and the electoral process.. Regarding your editorial "Scorched-Earth Judging in North Carolina" (Oct. 4): When voters elected two new justices to the North Carolina Supreme Court in 2020, they did so knowing full well who they were and what their job would be. One is Justice Tamara Barringer, a former state senator. The other is Phil Berger Jr., a former North Carolina Court of Appeals judge who was elevated by the voters to the state's highest court a full 10 years after his father became president pro tempore of the state Senate.

title: Tax Competition Will Outlive Yellen's Global Tax Deal
summary: Countries will still be free to define exclusions.. The proposed 15% global corporate minimum tax is a big idea ("The Global Tax Damage," Review & Outlook, Oct. 9), and on the surface it might seem like a no-brainer. But tax policy and legislative history, along with the history of the shenanigans used to get around restrictions provided by the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, prove that the 15% rate will not end up solving the problem. (A review of the changing Internal Revenue Code sections regarding domestic international sales corporations is instructive.)

title: 'The Child Is Not the Mere Creature of the State'
summary: Parents have rights, even before local school boards.. Gerard Baker appeals to Article 26.3 of the U.N. Declaration of Human Rights in affirmation of a parent's right to direct the learning of their children ("Merrick Garland Has a List, and You're Probably on It," Free Expression, Oct. 12), but there is more poignant support closer to home.

title: The Abuse of the Patriot Act
summary: All laws have unintended consequences. Better not to toe the line on individual rights.. I find it amusing that former Rep. James Sensenbrenner, author of a law that pushed the bounds of law enforcement, now cries foul that the law is being abused ("The Patriot Act Wasn't Meant to Target Parents," op-ed, Oct. 13). All laws have unintended consequences. Well-intentioned laws that border on the infringement of individual rights have the greatest potential for abuse.

title: Supply-Chain Bottlenecks, Elevated Inflation to Last Well Into 2022, Survey Finds
summary: Economists see supply constraints, labor shortages as bigger risks to economy than Covid-19, WSJ survey finds. Uncomfortably high inflation will grip the U.S. economy well into 2022, as constrained supply chains keep upward pressure on prices and, increasingly, curb output, according to economists surveyed this month by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Facebook Says AI Will Clean Up the Platform. Its Own Engineers Have Doubts.
summary: Resume Subscription. Facebook Inc. executives have long said that artificial intelligence would address the company's chronic problems keeping what it deems hate speech and excessive violence as well as underage users off its platforms.

title: The Astros Want to Move Past Their Cheating. Then Alex Cora Came Back to Town.
summary: The Red Sox manager was suspended for his role in the Astros' sign-stealing scandal. Now he's back and taking on Houston with a World Series berth at stake.. The people behind the sign-stealing scandal that tarnished the Houston Astros' championship in 2017, cost three managers their jobs and consumed the entire baseball world for months want to move on. The rest of the sport won't let them. Not yet, anyway.

title: Rising Mortgage Rates Shift Lenders' Focus to Home Buyers
summary: The 30-year mortgage is above 3% again, reducing the number of people looking to save money by refinancing. Mortgage lenders are refocusing on home buyers to drum up business during a slowdown in refinancing.

title: How to Fix Facebook, Instagram and Social Media? Change the Defaults
summary: Default settings in our social-media apps were designed to benefit companies and their bottom lines. What if regulation pushed them to benefit us?. Quick homework assignment: Open Instagram, tap the head icon at the bottom right, then the three lines in the top right corner, then Settings, then Privacy. (Almost there, I promise!) Tap Posts and switch on "Hide Likes and View Counts."

title: 8 Things to Know When Choosing a Medicare Plan
summary: The choices can be confusing, and the fine print is important. But it's crucial to choose wisely, because it may be hard to change your mind.. When most Americans turn 65, they have three basic options for health coverage: traditional Medicare; Medicare plus supplemental insurance to cover costs that Medicare doesn't; or Medicare Advantage, a range of managed-care plans.

title: Some Investors Say Bank Pledges on Arctic Drilling Contain Loopholes
summary: Controversy comes as world leaders and top financiers prepare for the United Nations climate conference on curbing carbon emissions. Some of the world's largest banks, including Goldman Sachs Group Inc., HSBC Holdings PLC and BNP Paribas SA, pledged in recent years to stop direct financing of Arctic oil exploration. The idea was to choke off money for fossil-fuel extraction in a pristine natural environment.

title: Afghan Resettlement Effort Slowed by Housing, Tech Constraints
summary: Many evacuees now living in cramped facilities on American military bases could be stuck there well into 2022. The push to resettle the first wave of Afghan evacuees brought to the U.S. is expected to take months longer than first anticipated as a measles scare, a nationwide housing shortage and paperwork delays have slowed the process, according to government and resettlement officials familiar with the effort.

title: Biden's Soft Infrastructure Agenda May Not Boost Growth
summary: Evidence of impact on economic output to support Democrats' multitrillion-dollar proposal is contested. As the Democrats who control Washington reshape a multi-trillion-dollar package that would expand the social safety net and boost green energy, a key question hanging over their efforts is what impact it will have on the economy.

title: India Embraces Stock Investing as Local Market Surges
summary: A bull market is accelerating a decadelong shift in how Indian families are investing. NEW DELHI-Indian stocks have risen more than any other major market in the world this year and that is enticing millions of local investors to put their savings into equities, further buoying the market.

title: Alibaba Faces New Threat as Shopping Habits Change
summary: E-commerce company, already under regulatory scrutiny, is losing market share as consumers shift from targeted product searches to browsing and interaction. TAIPEI- Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. , challenged by Beijing's yearlong clampdown on private enterprise, is facing another problem: growing competition.

title: With Few Cars to Sell, What Do Car Salespeople Do All Day?
summary: Dealerships lean on fewer staff to sell used cars, handle new-car buyers online; 'Haggling has gone out the window'. The global chip shortage has slashed vehicle inventories and left dealers with few cars to sell. It has also left car salesmen and women with less to do on the dealership lot.

title: 'Crazy' Bets on $200 Oil Invade the Options Market
summary: Traders are wagering U.S. crude's rally to a seven-year high is just the beginning, despite a softening global economic expansion. A roaring trade in bullish crude-oil options says the 2021 energy rally is far from over.

title: Tips for Taxpayers on Mutual-Fund Distributions and Charitable Giving
summary: With stock prices up this year, it's important for taxpayers to think about year-end fund distributions. It's not only what you do that counts. It's also when you do it.
